31.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
31.title: "The Beast of Wolfton"
31.author: by Richard Corben
31.appears_in: p. 8-15 in Heavy Metal, v. 3, no. 10 (Feb. 1980).
notes: Begins: "In remote ancient lands north of Canisland there lay vast forests called the Direbak. The people that lived there shivered and hid in the gloomy dark. Their fears were founded in more than groundless myths. Here the unknown menace was substantial and hovered horribly just beyond perception's limits."

35.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
35.title: "Bloodstar"
35.author: by Robert E

36.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
36.title: "Bloodstar"
36.author: by Robert E
36.appears_in: Howard ; illustrated by Richard Corben. p. 6-13 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 10 (Jan. 1981).
notes: "In the last episode, Earth was nearly destroyed by a huge, unforeseen orb, blasting from up above. It caused the waters to overflow, the earth to burn, and most of the planet's inhabitants to die in less than a fortnight. Remaining was a desolate planet, with only a few survivors.

37.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
37.title: "Bloodstar"
37.author: by Robert E
37.appears_in: Howard ; adapted by John Jakes and John Pocsik ; illustrated by Richard Corben. p. 7-16 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 12 (Mar. 1981).
notes: "Last we saw, Grom told young Bloodstar of his father. The two had met some years before during battle, when the elder Bloodstar defeated Grom while fighting but saved him from a cruel death by defending him against Helva, the daughter of the Aesir war chief. In the fight, Byrdag's regime beat Grom's jungle comrades, but talk of the old leader's possible retirement has one of the young warriors plotting ahead."

59.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
59.title: "Den"
59.author: by Richard Corben
59.appears_in: p. 29-44 in Heavy Metal : One Step Beyond (Heavy Metal Special ; v. 10, no. 1)

60.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
60.title: "Den II"
60.author: by Richard Corben
60.appears_in: p. 33-40 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 7 (Oct. 1981).

61.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
61.title: "Den II"
61.author: by Richard Corben
61.appears_in: p. 76-79 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 10 (Jan. 1982).
notes: "Den and Kath have bid farewell to Neverwhere and departed for Earth. Meanwhile, old Zeg has been confronted by the evil queen, who is searching for the Nar stones."

62.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
62.title: "Den II"
62.author: by Richard Corben
62.appears_in: p. 84-89 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 12 (Mar. 1982).
notes: "Tarn, left alone by Moda, was attacked by a strange creature, who was in turn attacked by the unusual Muvovum folk. Now a prisoner, Tarn awoke in a cell with Moda. It looked like curtains for both of them."

63.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
63.title: "Den II"
63.author: by Richard Corben
63.appears_in: p. 21-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 1 (Apr. 1982).
notes: "When we last saw Tarn and Moda, they were in the presence of Jord, the leader of the Muvovum people. He was accompanied by his pet, Jordella, who took an instant liking to Moda. Unfortunately, the feelings weren't mutual, and Moda threw Jordella to the ground. With that, the guards carried him off. The rest remains to be seen."

64.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
64.title: "Den II"
64.author: by Richard Corben
64.appears_in: p. 21-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 2 (May 1982).

65.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
65.title: "Den II"
65.author: by Richard Corben
65.appears_in: p. 20-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 3 (June 1982).

66.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
66.title: "Den II"
66.author: by Richard Corben
66.appears_in: p. 12-15 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 4 (July 1982).
notes: "When we last saw Tarn, he was tricked into making love by the creature Jordella, who had taken the form of Tarn's love, Muuta. After their lovemaking, the creature died, leaving poor Tarn sitting around wondering what was going to happen to him."

67.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
67.title: "Den II"
67.author: by Richard Corben
67.appears_in: p. 19-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 6 (Sept. 1982).
notes: "In our last issue, Den, who was living with the Lorung tribe, learned that Zeg was dead, Tarn had run away, and that Zegium was destroyed. Den left to search for Tran and avenge Zeg's death."

68.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
68.title: "Den II"
68.author: by Richard Corben
68.appears_in: p. 19-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 7 (Oct. 1982).
notes: "Last issue: Den continued searching for his friend Tarn. He came upon a Dramite hive of colossal size and entered the seemingly abandoned structure."

69.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
69.title: "Den II"
69.author: by Richard Corben
69.appears_in: p. 36-41 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 9 (Dec. 1982).

70.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
70.title: "Den II"
70.author: Richard Corben
70.appears_in: p. 14-19 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 11 (Feb. 1983).
notes: "When last we read, Tarn, who had become the king of the Lorungan Mts. and the Knorland Forests, returned to take his bride, Muuta. Soon after his arrival, Den discovered the Dramites' evil plans, and he, Muuta and the rest of the Minimuutan people planned their escape."

71.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
71.title: "Den II"
71.author: by Richard Corben
71.appears_in: p. 37-43 in Heavy Metal, v. 6, no. 12 (Mar. 1983).
notes: "When last we read, Muuta, Den, and the rest of the Minimuut people were planning their escape..."

120.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
120.appears_in: p. 5-12 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 11 (Feb. 1981).
notes: "In our last episode, while Bloodstar and his mentor, Grom, were on a hunting trip, they were attacked by wild boars. On his deathbed, Grom told the young Bloodstar of his origin and of his father, who defeated the King of the Northern Abyss."

121.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
121.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"

122.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
122.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
122.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
122.appears_in: p. 8-23 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 2 (May 1981).

123.heading: Corben, Richard, 1940-
123.title: "Robert E. Howard's Bloodstar"
123.author: by Richard Corben, John Jakes, and John Pocsik
123.appears_in: p. 15-24 in Heavy Metal, v. 5, no. 4 (July 1981).
notes: "While on the road, desperately attempting to avenge the death of his wife, Helva, Bloodstar met up with Loknar, Helva's former suitor and his mortal enemy. After a brutal hand-to-hand combat between the two, Bloodstar slew the ex-Aesir war chief, and encountered in the process the horrible demon who haunts the valley."
